channel.title: [Help] Skill Capes [Req]
channel.description: :confused:Hey people :confused: i just downloaded a very cool source but i realised it doesnt have any skill capes when the player reaches 99. I looked around by the search button but all the posts seem to be deleated. If your a coder and you know how to do it please can you reply with how to add to a server. THNX! :|

item.title: [Help] Skill Capes [Req]
item.dc:creator: @Taylor_John0 Taylor John0
item.description:
@Taylor_John0 wrote:

That’s why you do this
in the welcome message, say type ::imadeskillcapes
Then for the command ::imadeskillcapes
have it show a menu that shows each cape, and it’s requirements

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Skill Capes [Req]
item.dc:creator: @6aceofspades 6aceofspades
item.description:
@6aceofspades wrote:

Yep, it would be a bit hard to keep track of skillcapes if that were the case though. People would just be like, hey nice fremmy cape.

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Skill Capes [Req]
item.dc:creator: @Taylor_John0 Taylor John0
item.description:
@Taylor_John0 wrote:

Or, if he doesn’t want the emotes, he can just have capes that require 99 of whatever skill ^.^

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Skill Capes [Req]
item.dc:creator: @6aceofspades 6aceofspades
item.description:
@6aceofspades wrote:

No he’s just posting here to let everyone know that he doesn’t have them… and his title definatly doesn’t say. “[Help] Skill Capes [Req]”.
And my name isn’t,
Justin

Skillcapes are created by making items (you can do this with cases) do different emotes. Soo, with this information you should easialy be able to find the correct coding in another server and code it into your server. By the looks of it you don’t really know what you are doing though so I don’t reccomend it.

Read full topic
